chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the board class which stores all of the chess Pieces and handles the Pieces based on user input.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ronak Gandhi(rjg184) and Andrew Lowe(all157)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructor for the board class that will initialize all of the board spaces to be a Piece type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for the board class that will initialize all of the board spaces to be a Piece type.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToFileRank

        public static java.lang.String convertToFileRank(int row,
                                                 int column)
        This method will take an x and y index in a 2d array and convert it to its chess filerank. (Eg. row=0, column=0 returns a8)
        Parameters:
        row - an int variable that specifies the x location of the piece on the chess board.
        column - an int variable that specifies the y location of the piece on the chess board.
        Returns:
        returns a String variable that is the resulting filerank.

      • convertToArray

        public static int[] convertToArray(java.lang.String filerank)
        This method will take a filerank and convert it to its index x and index y values in the form of an array.
        Parameters:
        filerank - String variable that is the filerank of a spot on the board.
        Returns:
        int array variable that is length 2. index 0 of the array contains row and index 1 contains column.

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece(java.lang.String filerank)
        This method will take in a String filerank and return the Piece that is located at that filerank, if piece is empty, return null
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the String variable that corresponds to a location on the board.
        Returns:
        the Piece object that is located on the filerank

      • removePiece

        public boolean removePiece(java.lang.String filerank)
        method that removes a piece on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        filerank - where the piece to be removed is located.
        Returns:
        returns false if the method failed to remove the piece, else returns true if successfully removed the piece from the board.

      • setPiece

        public boolean setPiece(java.lang.String filerank,
                        Piece piece)
        method that puts a piece on the chess_board.
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the location on the chess baord where we are putting a new piece.
        piece - is the Piece object that we are putting onto the chess_board given a location on the chess_board.
        Returns:
        returns true if the action was successful, false otherwise.

      • removePieceFromList

        public void removePieceFromList(Player p,
                                int xposition,
                                int yposition)
        method that removes a player's piece from his/her arrayList
        Parameters:
        p - is the player who is getting a chess piece removed from their arraylist
        xposition - is the x index of the piece player p is losing from their arraylist
        yposition - is the y index of the piece player p is losing from their arraylist

      • getRow

        public int getRow(java.lang.String filerank)
        method that returns the row or x index given a String filerank(Eg. "e2")
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the String variable that contains the location of the spot on the chess board.
        Returns:
        returns the row or x index at the filerank's location.

      • getColumn

        public int getColumn(java.lang.String filerank)
        Returns the column or x index given at a String filerank(Eg. "e2")
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the String variable that contains the location of the spot on the chess board.
        Returns:
        returns the row or x index at the filerank's location.

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece(java.lang.String filerank,
                         Player p,
                         char newpiece)
        method that moves a chess piece from one location to another if valid. returns a boolean variable notifying if the move succeeded. Will handle enpassant,promotion, and castling moves as well as invalid moves in the case of a check.
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the String variable that contains the full move from the user.
        p - is the player who is making the move.
        newpiece - is the desired piece to promote a pawn to
        Returns:
        returns true if successfully moved piece, returns false otherwise

      • castle

        public boolean castle(java.lang.String filerank)
        method used for castling which includes switching the king and rook locations on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        filerank - the String input that would specify which castling move the player wishes to make.
        Returns:
        returns a boolean notifying whether or not the castling operation was successful.

      • revertCastle

        public void revertCastle(java.lang.String filerank)
        Reverts a castling move by moving the Rook back to its original position
        Parameters:
        filerank - is the String move entered by the player

      • promote

        public void promote(char color,
                    char newPiece,
                    Player p)
        Method that promotes the pawn if it reaches the other side of the board
        Parameters:
        color - the char variable representing if its white or black turn
        newPiece - the char variable that specifies which type of piece we are promoting the pawn to, could be a Queen, Rook, Knight, or Bishop
        p - is the player who is getting their piece promoted

      • spotUnderAttack

        public boolean spotUnderAttack(Player p,
                               int x,
                               int y)
        Checks if a certain spot on the board is under attack(the space must be null)
        Parameters:
        p - the player who is checking if a piece on the board is under attack
        x - the x index on the board which is being checked for danger
        y - the y index on the board which is being checked for danger
        Returns:
        returns true if the spot is in danger, else false if the spot is safe

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        prints out the whole chess_board and all of the pieces at their respective coordinates.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns a String
